page.title: 15Belvoir Joinery.
page.content: The Belvoir Joinery has been in existence for the last 12 years.For the last 2 years the Joinery has been in the old Village Reading Room next to the Village Hall.This was changed into a workshop with a new roof and new extension on the back of the building which cost Â£5,000.The company put in new equipment,a cutter,a hole puncher and slicer, which cost Â£3,000. They make tables, wardrobes,kitchen units,new stairs,shelves,doors,window frames and chairs.To make these they use redwood,pine,oak and hardboard which they buy from woodyards in Nottingham and Grantham.Last year they made some furniture for the "play corner" in our Infant classroom.The Melton Times photographer came and took photographs of the handing over of the furniture.
